revised_title: Effects of Vasopressin and Aldosterone on Amiloride Binding in Toad Bladder Epithelial Cells
tldr: This study investigates the effects of vasopressin and aldosterone on amiloride binding in toad bladder epithelial cells. The results show that vasopressin reduces the affinity of amiloride, while aldosterone increases the number of amiloride binding sites. These findings suggest that vasopressin and aldosterone may alter the entry of sodium into epithelial cells, affecting sodium transport.
